text:
i am a newbie, i need help.
I got this message when running the hs upload my-website-theme my-website-theme on vs code terminal
[ERROR] A portal needs to be supplied either via "--portal" or through setting a "defaultPortal"
either add `defaultPortal: <name of your portal config in this same file>` to `HubSpot.config.yml` or add `--portal <name of your portal config from the config file>`  as command line arg

my `HubSpot.config.yml` looks like this:

```defaultPortal: development
portals:
  - name: development
    portalId: XXX
    ....```
<@U0149PQC0HK> to confirm, it is JavaScript where you are hitting the file size limits? Do you use any HubL in your JavaScript?
Yes. Haven't tried since June though. It's the vendor bundle with React and all other external stuff. And no HubL in JS.
Obviously would be best if that vendor bundle would stay minified and our own sources not when building with webpack but I don't know if or how to do that with webpack :slightly_smiling_face:
Sounds good - we are actually pretty close to beta with a new concept of plain JavaScript (not JS + HubL) that will not have the same file size restrictions.
